CSV parsing that removes commas inside quoted strings, removes quotes, splits into columns/values and stores each sub-table.
Load 2024_CSN_State_Rankings_Identity_Theft_Reports.csv, 2024_CSN_State_Rankings_Fraud_and_Other_Reports.csv, all csv in State MSA Identity Theft data/.
For every state/territory (row[1] is name) locate its row in both tables and add the two report counts (row[3] from each table) to get that state’s total number of all reports.
Determine the single state/territory with the highest combined total of reports across the two tables.
Open that state’s per-state MSA identity-theft file in “State MSA Identity Theft data/<state>.csv”.
Within the sub-table “Metropolitan Areas: Identity Theft Reports” convert the report count in column 1 to int and find the metropolitan area (row[0]) with the maximum value.
Return / print the name of this metropolitan area as the answer.
